anax.name: Anax
anax.author: @miguelmartin75
anax.description: anax is an open source C++ entity system designed to be portable, lightweight and easy to use.

artemis.name: Artemis
artemis.author: @vinova
artemis.description: A C++ port of Artemis Entity System Framework.

entityx1.name: EntityX
entityx1.author: @alecthomas
entityx1.description: Entity Component Systems (ECS) are a form of decomposition that completely decouples entity logic and data from the entity 'objects' themselves.

entityx2.name: EntityX (experimental/compile_time)
entityx2.author: @alecthomas
entityx2.description: Entity Component Systems (ECS) are a form of decomposition that completely decouples entity logic and data from the entity 'objects' themselves.

enttlegacy.name: EnTT (legacy)
enttlegacy.author: @skypjack
enttlegacy.description: EnTT is a header-only, tiny and easy to use entity-component system in modern C++.

entt.name: EnTT
entt.author: @skypjack
entt.description: EnTT is a header-only, tiny and easy to use library for game programming and much more written in modern C++, mainly known for its innovative entity-component-system (ECS) model.

ginseng.name: Ginseng
ginseng.author: @apples
ginseng.description: Ginseng is an entity-component-system (ECS) library designed for use in games.

ecs.name: ECS
ecs.author: @redxdev
ecs.description: This is a simple C++ header-only type-safe entity component system library. It makes heavy use of C++11 constructs, so make sure you have an up to date compiler. It isn't meant to do absolutely everything, so please feel free to modify it when using.
